arts.ttl: Milan 2 – Bari 0 | Landucci’s press conference: “Leao? We will assess the injury…”
arts.sum: Marco Landucci, AC Milan’s assistant coach, spoke in the press conference after Milan – Bari. How do you rate the first match? "As in every game, we’re satisfied with some things and less with others. Beyond the numbers: Tomori provided an assist as a full-back. These are things we had prepared to improve our occupation […]

arts.ttl: Milan 2 Bari 0 | Gabbia: “We’re happy to have started on the right foot”
arts.sum: At the end of Milan-Bari, Matteo Gabbia spoke to Mediaset microphones: “We’ve tried to put last season behind us. We’re training well for a great campaign, and we’ve got the right mindset. We’re happy to have started on the right foot. Thanks to the fans, seeing a stadium like this on August 17 is incredible." […]

arts.ttl: Milan 2 – Bari 0 | Ricci: “We’re aiming high, our goal is to give everything we have”
arts.sum: Samuele Ricci, making his official debut with Milan today, spoke to Mediaset after the Milan – Bari match. His words: A good start, you moved well: “We played a good game, though there are still things to fine-tune. We created plenty of chances and could have been more clinical. We managed possession well, and at […]

arts.ttl: Milan 2 Bari 0 | A strong start of the season for Allegri’s team
arts.sum: A perfect start for Massimiliano Allegri’s Milan... At San Siro, the Rossoneri win 2-0 against Bari in the Coppa Italia Round of 32. The next opponent for the red and black faithful in the competition will be Francesco Camarda’s Lecce. Below is the story of the match at San Siro. Milan - Bari: first half... […]

arts.ttl: Pulisic believes Milan ‘could have scored even more’ vs. Bari: “One game at a time”
arts.sum: By: Oliver Fisher Christian Pulisic was happy with how AC Milan started their season, but believes they could have scored even more against Bari. On a personal note for Pulisic, he got his campaign started in a brilliant way by scoring early in the second half. arts.ttl: Watch: Pulisic and Gimenez link up to double Milan’s lead against Bari
arts.sum: By: Oliver Fisher Christian Pulisic got his first goal of the new season against Bari in the Coppa Italia, linking up nicely with Santiago Gimenez. It took Milan just 140 seconds from the restart to double their advantage. A Bari give-away in their own half allowed Gimenez to find Pulisic with a give-and-go. In the 14th minute, the first goal of Allegri’s second reign came and it was through Leao.
